world_news:
• [Nov 25, 10:30 AM] Gaza Flooding: Severe flooding in Gaza has inundated the makeshift tents of displaced Palestinians, worsening the humanitarian crisis as winter approaches. Heavy rains have destroyed temporary shelters, leaving many without protection from the cold and wet conditions.
  • [Nov 25, 9:00 AM] US-Japan Relations: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi reported having a positive first phone call with U.S. President Donald Trump, who told her to "call anytime." This initial communication is seen as a step toward strengthening ties between the two nations.
  • [Nov 24, 4:23 PM] US-China Relations: U.S. President Donald Trump and Chinese leader Xi Jinping held a phone call, which Trump described as fostering "extremely strong" relations. During the call, Xi emphasized that Taiwan's "return to China" is a fundamental part of Beijing's global vision.
  • [Nov 24, 2:00 PM] Lebanon Papal Visit: Pope Leo XIV's visit to Lebanon is being seen as a beacon of hope for the nation, which has been severely affected by war and ongoing crises. The visit aims to promote peace and solidarity in the region.
  • [Nov 24, 1:00 PM] Hezbollah Commander Mourned: Thousands of mourners gathered to pay their respects to a Hezbollah commander who was killed in a recent Israeli airstrike, highlighting the ongoing tensions and conflict in the Middle East.
  • [Nov 25, 11:00 AM] Venezuelan Oil: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro is considering offering crude oil cargoes, which are typically sold to China, to other international buyers. This move is seen as a way to navigate economic sanctions and generate much-needed revenue.
  • [Nov 25, 12:00 PM] China-Japan Tensions: China has condemned Japan's plan to deploy missiles on an island near Taiwan, calling it a provocative move aimed at creating regional instability and military confrontation.
  • [Nov 24, 8:37 AM] DOGE Investigation: An exclusive report reveals that the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), a key initiative in the early months of Trump's second term, is facing scrutiny and may be disbanded, with only eight months left on its charter.
  • [Nov 25, 10:00 AM] UK Economic Update: The UK's economic outlook is being closely watched as new financial data is released. Reuters is providing ongoing coverage of the market's reaction and the government's response to the latest figures.
  • [Nov 25, 9:30 AM] Global Health Initiatives: New developments in global health are being reported, with a focus on international cooperation to combat emerging diseases and improve healthcare access in developing nations.
us_news:
• [Nov 25, 9:21 AM] Topic: Japan-US Relations: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi and U.S. President Donald Trump spoke by phone for the first time since Takaichi's recent diplomatic incident with China. Takaichi stated that Trump told her to 'call anytime,' highlighting the bond between the two leaders.
  • [Nov 25, 12:31 AM] Topic: Rick Fox Enters Politics: Three-time NBA champion Rick Fox announced he is running for a seat in the Bahamian House of Assembly. The election is scheduled to be held no later than October.
  • [Nov 24, 7:32 PM] Topic: Tulsa Race Massacre Survivor Dies: Viola Fletcher, the oldest living survivor of the 1921 Tulsa Race Massacre, passed away at the age of 111. The news was confirmed by the city's mayor.
  • [Nov 24, 2:25 PM] Topic: Obamacare Subsidies: A report indicates that Americans who rely on Obamacare subsidies are delaying or forgoing health insurance enrollment due to uncertainty about premium hikes in 2026, with one state reporting a 33% drop in enrollment.
  • [Nov 24, 1:52 PM] Topic: Trump-Mamdani Meeting: In a surprising move, President Trump met with New York City's progressive Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani. The meeting was described as 'civil,' with a focus on affordability issues.
  • [Nov 24, 11:51 AM] Topic: US Military in Caribbean: The top U.S. military officer, Gen. Dan Caine, is visiting American troops in Puerto Rico and a Navy warship in the Caribbean. The visit comes as the Trump administration increases pressure on Venezuela.
  • [Nov 24, 7:11 PM] Topic: US-Venezuela Relations: The Trump administration has designated the Venezuelan group 'Cartel de los Soles' as a foreign terrorist organization. The Venezuelan government rejected the designation of the 'non-existent' group.
  • [Nov 24, 5:55 AM] Topic: Education Department Reorganization: The Trump administration is reportedly requiring non-disclosure agreements from individuals involved in the ongoing reorganization and planned dismantling of the Department of Education.
  • [Nov 24, 7:16 PM] Topic: US-Ukraine Peace Talks: Negotiators are continuing to work on a potential peace agreement between the United States and Ukraine ahead of a Thanksgiving deadline set by President Trump. Key officials state that progress is being made.
  • [Nov 25, 10:09 AM] Topic: Medicare Drug Price Negotiations: The U.S. government is expected to announce negotiated prices for 15 high-cost prescription drugs under the Medicare program this week.
tech_news:
• [Nov 25, 12:11 PM] Microsoft Copilot on WhatsApp: Microsoft's AI chatbot, Copilot, will no longer be available on WhatsApp starting January 15, 2026, due to new platform policies by the messaging service that ban general-purpose AI chatbots.
  • [Nov 25, 11:14 AM] AI in Mining: Fleet Space has utilized AI and satellite technology to discover a significant lithium deposit in Quebec, Canada, suggesting the area may hold more of the valuable mineral than previously estimated.
  • [Nov 25, 10:15 AM] Spotify Price Hike: Spotify is expected to increase its subscription prices in the United States in the first quarter of 2026, following pressure from major record labels to adjust for inflation.
  • [Nov 24, 9:03 AM] Social Media Regulation: The Malaysian government is considering a ban on social media access for users under the age of 16, with potential implementation of age verification systems starting next year.
  • [Nov 24, 5:27 PM] OpenAI Trademark Issue: OpenAI is facing a potential trademark issue with its Sora app's "cameo" feature, as the word has been trademarked by the celebrity video message company Cameo.
  • [Nov 24, 4:10 PM] Tesla FSD in EU: Contrary to claims made by Tesla, the Dutch regulator has not yet approved the company's Full Self-Driving (FSD) software for use in the European Union.
  • [Nov 24, 7:30 AM] Rocket Lab's Neutron Delays: Rocket Lab's CEO, Pete Beck, discussed the delays in the development of the Neutron rocket, the success of the New Glenn, and the company's relationship with NASA in an interview on November 24, 2025.
  • [Nov 24, 6:56 PM] UN Climate Negotiations: The UN climate negotiations in Brazil were disrupted after a fire broke out at the event venue, leading to an early end to the talks.
conspiracies: • [Nov 29, 2024, 12:00 AM] Theory: The movie "The Substance" is an allegory for the occult elite's obsession with adrenochrome and ritual humiliation. The film's narrative about a youth-restoring substance is a veiled reference to the conspiracy theory that elites harvest a chemical compound called adrenochrome from terrified children to achieve immortality and euphoria. The movie's themes of humiliation and transformation are symbolic of occult rituals and the degradation of society.
